channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Lights out - AGAIN, 5th October
item.description:
We’re back to the same old story. Things get fixed poorly and half-heartedly, so instead of a permanent solution, it’s just a patch-up job. As a result, not long after the supposed fix, it breaks down again, and we’re back to square one, having to file complaints. This leads to yet another temporary fix, causing inconvenience to the neighbours and wasting both time and money for the council. So why not, once and for all, properly fix the streetlight that has broken for the millionth time and has been out for over a month, leaving the street as dark as a cave and unsafe to walk through? I’ve also seen that it was reported again on the 15th of September, yet nothing has changed – we’re still without light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in pavement and cast iron drain sunk, 5th October
item.description:
Sink Hole/Pothole & sinking iron drain outside entrance to no 16 gratton Road, cheltenham,GL50 2BU. To mitigate any pedestrian having a serious fall, a traffic cone has been placed over the sink hole/pothole. This has got bigger over last few weeks hence someones act of kindness resulted in a cone appearing do hazard aware.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Gratton Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham

item.title: Possible diseased tree, 5th October

item.title: Enormous pothole that can’t be avoided on narrow strip of cudnall st, 5th October
item.description:
Please do PERMANENT fix. You keep doing temporary fixes that only last a few weeks. The volume of traffic using Cudnall St as a cut through means you need to keep the street in working order or stop it being used as a cut through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37-39, Cudnall Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown road gully and drainage, 5th October
item.description:
As previously reported there is heavy vegetation in the riad gullies blocking the drain and lowered crossing. I received an email a few days ago informing me that this had been cleared. The pictures attached were taken at approximately 11.20am the morning of 5th October illustrating that the work has obviously not been carried out as suggested.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairview Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entire stretch of pavement along Bisley Road and Farmington Road are uneven and a serious trip hazard., 5th October
item.description:
The entire pavement along Bisley Road and Farmington Road up to Bibury Road is in a terrible state. The slabs are extremely uneven and on the twice daily walk to Benhall Infant School, my child trips and falls repeatedly. She asked for knee pads and gloves for her recent birthday because she falls so often along this stretch! It has clearly been in this state for many years. It has been like this since we moved to the area one year ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Bisley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road due to poor pothole filling, 4th October
item.description:
Near the pedestrian crossing and going down towards the traffic lights on both lanes of the road the surface is really uneven. On a bike you have to cycle in the middle of the road to avoid them which is dangerous due to the high volume of traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bayshill Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
